original_fears: Student loan debt and financial stress
current_fears: Student loan debt and financial stress

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Lisa expressed overwhelming stress about research proposals, loan debt, and lecture anxiety. Solutions offered included: 1) Structured application drafting with professor feedback, 2) Lecture recording for desensitization, 3) Financial aid meeting, and 4) Scheduled family calls. Lisa implemented key solutions immediately: emailed Dr. Carter with specific questions, blocked work time, called her mother, recorded a practice lecture, and submitted her application. Progress is evident through her adoption of concrete strategies (color-coding interview prep, using cloud storage), decreased defensiveness (accepting templates while pretending annoyance), and proactive outreach to professors. Her anxiety visibly decreased from initial panic to focused action.

Lisa discussed overwhelming academic pressures (research proposals, teaching anxiety, loan stress) and homesickness. Solutions offered included: 1) Time-blocking for tasks, 2) Structured professor outreach (email drafts + printed copies), 3) Lecture recording practice, 4) Scheduled family calls/budget time, and 5) Cloud backups. Lisa initially resisted but implemented: emailed Dr. Carter, recorded lecture successfully, submitted applications, and created organizational systems (color-coding, templates). Progress evidenced by: research application submission, lecture recording accomplishment, scheduled budget/karaoke self-care integration, and proactive resource management (cloud storage, professor feedback).

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed: 1) Overwhelming workload causing all-nighters, 2) Loan statements triggering financial panic, 3) Teaching anxiety in lectures, 4) Research applications determining career path. Solutions: Time-blocking for tasks, recording practice lectures, scheduled family calls, targeted professor feedback. Response: Initially resistant (dismissed Pomodoro), but implemented scheduling, called mom, submitted research applications, and recorded lecture. Progress: Completed proposal draft, scheduled decompression time, created loan spreadsheet, applied to multiple positions with color-coded organization.
